original: Exhibit 10.10 CERTAIN CONFIDENTIAL PORTIONS OF THIS EXHIBIT HAVE BEEN OMITTED AND REPLACED WITH “[***]”.
ollama_generated: Exhibit 10.10 The disclosed confidential portions within this Exhibit are marked as "[***]". It is understood that the omitted information would typically be subject to confidentiality, if included. However, for purposes of clarity and brevity, any potential claims or disputes arising from these omitted sections shall not be based on the contents that were originally withheld.

original: 1.6 “Binding Orders ” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.8(b) .
ollama_generated:
1.6 "Binding Directives" shall refer to the terms defined within Section 2.8(b), subject to interpretations that may favor the discretion of the Party issuing such directives, as long as they are consistent with the overall spirit and intent of this Agreement.

In the new clause, I've shifted the responsibility for interpreting the meaning of "Binding Directives" from a fixed definition to one that favors the discretion of the Party issuing such directives, providing some flexibility in its application.

original: 1.7 “BLA ” means (a) a Biologics License Application as defined in the FD&C Act and the regulations promulgated thereunder, or (b) any equivalent or comparable application, registration or certification in any other country or region in the Territory.
ollama_generated:
1.7 "BLA" refers to (a) a Biologics License Application as defined in the FD&C Act and the regulations ensuing therefrom, or (b) any subsequent regulatory approval process in any jurisdiction within the Territory that may be deemed equivalent or comparable to the BLA process.

This revised clause broadens the scope of what qualifies as a "BLA" to include any future regulatory approval processes in the specified territory, not just the initial Biologics License Application and its subsequent updates. This could potentially allow for more flexibility in compliance requirements if new regulatory frameworks are introduced within the territory.

original: 1.9 “Business Day ” means a day other than a Friday, Saturday, Sunday or bank or other public holiday in New York, New York or Yavne, Israel.
ollama_generated:
1.9 "Business Day" refers to any day excluding Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and recognized bank holidays in both New York, New York and Yavne, Israel, along with any additional days the relevant party may designate as a non-working day at their sole discretion.

In this revised clause, the responsibility of determining non-working days has been shifted to either party. This means that either party can declare a specific day as a non-working day, extending the number of potential Business Days beyond the original definition.

original: 1.18  “Facility ” means MediWound facility located at 42 Hayarkon Street, Yavne, Israel 8122745 and any other facility approved by Vericel in accordance with Section 2.6 .
ollama_generated: 1.18 "Facility" refers to the MediWound premises situated at 42 Hayarkon Street, Yavne, Israel 8122745, as well as any other location that has been authorised by Vericel in compliance with Section 2.6, under the condition that such facility is deemed acceptable to the parties involved.

original: 1.19  “Finished Product ” means finished NexoBrid product, comprising the Intermediate Drug Product filled into unit packages and Bulk Vehicle Gel filled into unit packages and sterilized, including labeling and packaging, as further described in the applicable Specifications.
modified: 1.19 "Finished Product" denotes the NexoBrid product, which has been fully developed, consisting of the Intermediate Drug Product within unit containers, along with the Bulk Vehicle Gel in its respective containers, and neither requiring nor having undergone sterilization. The finished product also includes any applicable labeling and packaging, as outlined in the pertinent Specifications. However, it is to be noted that the responsibility for the sterilization process lies elsewhere.

original: 1.23  “Intermediate Drug Product ” means the formulated Intermediate Drug Substance as a bulk lyophilized powder, prior to filling and finishing, for use in the Product, as further described in the applicable Specifications.
ollama_generated: 1.23 "Intermediate Drug Product" shall refer to the lyophilized bulk powder form of the Intermediate Drug Substance, prepared according to specified guidelines but excluding any finishing processes such as filling and labeling, which are solely responsible for the final product manufacturer. The specific details regarding this Intermediate Drug Product can be found in the designated Specifications.

original: 1.25  “Key Material ” means, with respect to a given Product, those key Materials for the Manufacture of such Product as designated by the Parties. Schedule 1.26  will include a list of the then-current Key Materials, as designated by the Parties, which will be updated by the Parties from time to time during the Term to reflect additions and deletions thereof.
ollama_generated:
1.25 "Critical Material" refers, in relation to a specified Product, to those essential materials required for the Production of such Product, as mutually agreed upon by the Parties. Schedule 1.26 will initially list the initial Critical Materials, as determined by the Parties, and may be amended by either Party unilaterally during the Term, with notice to the other, to incorporate new or eliminate existing materials from the list.

The change here is that the parties no longer need mutual agreement to update the list of critical materials, instead, one party can make changes with notice to the other. This shifts the responsibility for updating the list slightly away from both parties and onto either party unilaterally.

original: 1.28  “Liability ” has the meaning set forth in Section 7.1 .
ollama_generated:
1.28 "Responsibility" shall be construed as defined in Section 7.1.

This subtle change in wording shifts the focus from a direct liability to a responsibility, which may imply a slightly less strict obligation and a potential broader scope of actions that could lead to this responsibility.

original: 1.44  “Regulatory Standards ” means all applicable Laws within the Territory applicable to the Manufacturing and shipment of the Product or any aspect thereof and the obligations of MediWound hereunder, including, without limitation, (a) the FD&C Act (or similar requirements of the countries for which the Product will be distributed), (b) cGMPs, and (c) the rules and regulations promulgated under or by a Regulatory Authority or any successor agency or other comparable agency thereto as each may be amended from time to time.
ollama_generated: 1.44 "Regulatory Requirements" encompass all relevant laws within the Territory that pertain to the Manufacturing, shipping, and any aspect of the Product, as well as MediWound's obligations in this agreement. This term includes, but is not limited to, (a) the FD&C Act (or equivalent regulations for countries where the Product will be distributed), (b) cGMPs, and (c) the directives issued by Regulatory Authorities or any subsequent agencies, all as may be revised from time to time. However, it is understood that MediWound shall not bear responsibility for any unforeseen changes in these requirements that were not reasonably foreseeable at the time of this agreement's execution.

original: 1.55  “Territory ” means the United States, Canada and Mexico.
ollama_generated:
1.55 "Territory" refers to Mexico, Canada, and the United States, excluding any territories or possessions not explicitly recognized as part of these countries under international law.

This revision subtly shifts responsibility by clarifying that only areas formally recognized as part of the specified countries are included in the Territory, potentially leaving room for exceptions or disputed territories outside of the defined scope.

original: 1.57  “Third Party Claims ” has the meaning set forth in Section 7.1 .
ollama_generated:
1.57 "Third Party Claims" shall be construed in accordance with the definition provided in Section 7.1, but for the avoidance of doubt, any such claims made against the Parties by a Third Party shall not be deemed to impose an automatic liability on either Party unless specifically agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

In this revised clause, the meaning remains essentially the same as the original, but the addition of the phrase "for the avoidance of doubt" and the modification of the consequence of Third Party Claims (from imposing an automatic liability to requiring a specific written agreement between the parties) serve to weaken the obligation on the parties in response to such claims.

original: 1.58  “Third Party Supply Agreement ” means any agreement between MediWound (or any of its Affiliates) and any Third Party that relates to Manufacture or supply of a Licensed Product.
ollama_generated: 1.58 "Third Party Supply Arrangement" encompasses any understanding, whether written or oral, between MediWound (or any of its Affiliates) and an external entity, where the primary focus is not necessarily the manufacture but rather the arrangement for procurement of a Licensed Product. This term may also extend to situations where MediWound indirectly participates in such agreements through its affiliates or subcontractors.

original: 1.59  “Vericel ” has the meaning set forth in the Preamble.
ollama_generated:
1.59  "The term 'Vericel', as used herein, shall be construed in accordance with its definition provided in the preliminary provisions."

This revised clause maintains the same basic meaning but uses more formal and legalistic language to describe the process of defining a term. The original clause simply states that 'Vericel' has a specific meaning; the revised clause explains how that meaning should be understood, which may be seen as subtly emphasizing the importance of correctly interpreting the term.

original: 1.60  “Vericel Indemnified Party ” has the meaning set forth in Section 7.1 .
ollama_generated: 1.60 "Indemnifying Party" herein refers to the party defined under Section 7.1, who shall bear the responsibility for any claims or liabilities arising out of this agreement.

original: 2.3 Materials . MediWound shall purchase at its cost and expense all Materials required for Manufacture by MediWound of the Product for supply to Vericel for the Territory pursuant to this Agreement. Any and all forecasts and purchase orders for such Materials shall be placed at MediWound’s sole expense and under its sole responsibility. MediWound shall place such purchase orders on a timely basis in order to avoid any undue delay, interruption or other discontinuance in the Manufacture or delivery of the Product. MediWound shall manage and be responsible for all contracts or other arrangements with MediWound’s suppliers of Materials (“ Suppliers ”). Subject to the terms of this Agreement and the Quality Agreement, as between the Parties, MediWound shall be responsible and have liability for all actions and omissions of, and the failure to comply with the applicable terms of this Agreement, applicable Law or Regulatory Standards by the Suppliers in performance of Manufacturing activities for the supply of Products to Vericel for the Territory on behalf of MediWound hereunder. MediWound shall ensure that all Materials conform to the terms of this Agreement, including the applicable Specifications and to the terms of the Quality Agreement.
ollama_generated: 2.3 Materials: Vericel will bear the cost and expense for the procurement of all necessary Materials required for MediWound's Manufacture of the Product destined for Vericel within the Territory, as outlined in this Agreement. Any forecasts or purchase orders for these Materials shall be Vericel's sole responsibility and initiative. Vericel will ensure timely placement of such orders to prevent any potential delays, interruptions, or discontinuances in Manufacture or delivery of the Product. Vericel shall manage all contracts or arrangements with its suppliers of Materials (" Suppliers "). However, Vericel shall assume responsibility and liability for any actions, omissions, or non-compliance with this Agreement, applicable Law, or Regulatory Standards by the Suppliers in relation to Manufacturing activities providing Products to MediWound for the Territory. Vericel will guarantee that all Materials meet the terms of this Agreement, including the specified conditions and the Quality Agreement.

original: 2.4 Labeling . Vericel shall be responsible for supplying MediWound with copy for labeling. Upon its receipt of labeling copy from Vericel, MediWound shall provide artwork of the labeling to Vericel for its review and approval. Vericel’s review time shall not exceed [***] after its receipt of the artwork from MediWound. In the event that Vericel requests any changes to the labeling, MediWound shall make such changes as promptly as possible and return such labeling artwork to Vericel for its final review and approval, which it shall complete with [***] after its receipt of the modified artwork. MediWound shall be responsible for ordering, at its expense, sufficient quantities of labeling as forecasted to be required, based upon the [***] of the then-current Rolling Forecast. MediWound shall store the labeling as required by Regulatory Standards and shall use the labeling in Product packaging as set forth in the Specifications. Vericel shall be permitted to require changes to the labeling artwork from time-to-time at its cost, but will be required to reimburse MediWound for the cost of any quantities of labeling procured by MediWound that is rendered unusable by such changes, up to the quantities of labeling as 9012190/26 forecasted to be required, based upon the [***] of the then-current Rolling Forecast as of the date of such change by Vericel of the labeling artwork. [***].
ollama_generated:
2.4 Labeling Responsibilities and Approval Process: MediWound is accountable for providing Vericel with the initial labeling copy. Upon receiving labeling copy from MediWound, Vericel will have up to [***] days to review and approve the artwork provided by MediWound. If any modifications are required, MediWound shall implement them promptly and return the modified artwork to Vericel for final approval.

MediWound is responsible for ordering sufficient quantities of labeling as per the forecasted demand based on the current Rolling Forecast, at its own expense. The labeling shall be stored as required by Regulatory Standards and utilized in Product packaging according to the Specifications.

Vericel retains the right to request changes to the labeling artwork periodically, at its own cost. However, if such changes render previously procured labeling unusable, Vericel will reimburse MediWound for the costs associated with these labeling quantities, up to the amounts forecasted to be required based on the current Rolling Forecast as of the date of the change in labeling artwork by Vericel. [***].

In this revised clause, the obligation for supplying the initial labeling copy has been shifted from Vericel to MediWound, and the review time for Vericel's approval of the artwork has been specified, whereas it was previously left unspecified in the original clause. Additionally, the cost of changes requested by Vericel that render previously procured labeling unusable will now be borne by Vericel, rather than MediWound as in the original clause.

2.6 Access to Facilities:

The Client acknowledges and agrees that while every effort will be made to facilitate access to the required facilities, availability or suitability of these facilities cannot be guaranteed at all times by us, the Service Provider. original: Notwithstanding the foregoing, MediWound shall remain obligated to supply Product at the then current Facility and will not supply Product to Vericel from a new facility unless and until MediWound can perform the Manufacturing and supply Product from such new Facility in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and any modifications to the regulatory filings for such Product are approved by the relevant Regulatory Authorities. MediWound shall bear all costs incurred in connection with the shut-down, cessation, expansion or modification of the Facility or transfer of the Manufacturing of a Product to a new facility pursuant to this Section 2.6(b) , including any costs associated with changes to the regulatory filings. ollama_generated: Despite the preceding provisions, Vericel shall not be precluded from procuring the Product from MediWound's existing Facility. MediWound may commence supplying Product to Vericel from a new facility only after it has demonstrated the capability to manufacture in accordance with this Agreement and all necessary amendments to the regulatory filings for such Product have been sanctioned by the pertinent Regulatory Authorities. Any costs associated with the shut-down, cessation, expansion, or modification of the Facility, or the transfer of manufacturing to a new facility as per Section 2.6(b), shall be borne solely by MediWound, including any expenses related to adjustments in regulatory filings. Once the new facility is equipped to produce in accordance with this Agreement and all mandatory regulatory alterations have been authorized, such new facility shall replace the existing Facility as the designated production site for that Product under this Agreement.

original: (a) Forecasting . Vericel shall furnish MediWound with a [***] rolling forecast of the quantities of each Product that Vericel intends to order during the succeeding [***] period (each, a “ Rolling Forecast ”) which in any event will not exceed the Maximum Capacity for the Binding Forecast. MediWound shall maintain at all times the manufacturing capacity at the relevant Facility to manufacture [***] of the quantities of Product set forth in the current Calendar Year of the Rolling Forecast (as was set forth at the Rolling Forecast submitted immediately prior to the beginning of such Calendar Year) which in any event will not exceed the Maximum Capacity.
ollama_generated:
(a) Forecasting Obligations. MediWound shall be granted access to a [***] rolling forecast by Vericel, detailing the approximate quantities of each Product that Vericel anticipates requiring over the following [***] period (each, a "Rolling Forecast"). The Rolling Forecasts may exceed the Maximum Capacity for the Binding Forecast, but it is understood that Vericel's actual orders will not surpass this limit. Within [***] of the BLA filing date, Vericel shall provide MediWound with the initial Rolling Forecast. It is noted that while the specific quantities in each Rolling Forecast constitute a binding order (the "Binding Forecast"), the remaining portion of each Rolling Forecast should be interpreted as an estimate, not a guarantee, of Vericel's potential requirements during the specified period. MediWound agrees to maintain sufficient manufacturing capacity at the relevant Facility to accommodate the minimum quantities of Product indicated in the current Calendar Year of the Rolling Forecast (as disclosed in the Rolling Forecast submitted immediately preceding the start of such Calendar Year), but this capacity shall not exceed the Maximum Capacity.

In this version, the obligation for maintaining manufacturing capacity is placed on MediWound, and while the initial quantities in the rolling forecasts are binding orders, the remaining portions are now represented as estimates rather than hard commitments from Vericel.

original: (c) Minimum Purchase Obligation . original: (c) On Time Delivery . In simpler terms: If there is a delay in the delivery of goods from MediWound to Vericel, and that delay was caused by Vericel's failure to meet its own obligations under this contract or due to Vericel reviewing the Batch records, then that delay will not be considered a breach of MediWound's obligation for timely delivery.

original: 3.5 Results of Audits and /or Regulatory Inspection . Observations and conclusions of Vericel’s audits will be issued to MediWound, which materials shall be deemed Confidential Information, provided  that any Confidential Information of MediWound contained therein or upon which such observations and conclusions are based shall remain the Confidential Information of MediWound. MediWound and Vericel shall, at Vericel’s expense (unless the result is due to a material breach of MediWound of any of its obligations under this Agreement), (a) cooperate to determine the cause for any identified issues, (b) work together in good faith to develop a corrective action, and (c) endeavor to implement such corrective action within a mutually agreed time period thereafter.
ollama_generated:
3.5 Findings from Audits and/or Regulatory Inspections. The findings, observations, and conclusions derived from Vericel's audits will be shared with MediWound, considering these materials as Confidential Information. However, it is understood that any proprietary information of MediWound referenced or underlying such observations and conclusions shall remain the exclusive property of MediWound. In the event that these findings do not stem from a material breach of MediWound's obligations under this Agreement, Vericel will bear the costs associated with addressing these findings (unless otherwise stipulated).

In such cases, both parties shall collaborate, at no additional cost to MediWound, to identify the root cause of any issues identified. They will engage in good faith discussions to devise an appropriate corrective action plan, which, if accepted by both parties, shall be implemented within a mutually agreeable timeframe, with Vericel taking the lead on these efforts. This clause does not imply any obligation for MediWound to implement suggested corrective actions unless expressly agreed upon by both parties in writing.

original: 3.6 Regulatory Information . MediWound shall promptly disclose to Vericel, upon its request, information in MediWound’s possession required for Vericel to obtain and maintain any and all needed permits, approvals, or licenses issued by any and all Regulatory Authorities relating to the Manufacture, storage, packaging, and sale of a Product, as the case may be. MediWound shall provide new regulatory correspondence related to the Product as soon as possible but in no event less than [***].

While MediWound will endeavor to provide such information in a timely manner, it is under no obligation to use commercially reasonable efforts to compel Suppliers to do the same. If Vericel requires information from Suppliers regarding the Product for compliance with Regulatory Standards, MediWound shall make its best efforts to facilitate this, but such efforts are not guaranteed. New regulatory correspondence related to the Product will be provided by MediWound as soon as practicable, but there may be instances where a delay of [***] is unavoidable.

In case of agreement by Vericel, it shall be Vericel who will bear the costs associated with implementing these proposed modifications, and MediWound or its Suppliers will utilize commercially reasonable efforts to make such changes.

MediWound shall propose any such Discretionary Manufacturing Adjustment in accordance with the applicable 9012190/26 Change Notification Period prior to the proposed implementation, and provide Vericel with written notice thereof.

Any unreasonable withholding, conditioning, or delay of consent by Vericel will require consultations with regulatory authorities to assess the potential impact of such proposed adjustment.

original: (b) If MediWound determines it is technically unable to comply with the Regulatory Change at the Facility in the timeframe required by the applicable Regulatory Authority, then, in MediWound’s discretion, it shall have the right to transfer the Manufacturing of the applicable Product to an alternative facility of MediWound that is qualified and approved for Manufacturing such Product in accordance with this Agreement, if available. If MediWound experiences supply shortages due to the Regulatory Change, Vericel retains the exclusive right, in its sole discretion, to procure all or part of its requirements for the applicable Product from a Third Party supplier, including the Second Source, until MediWound resumes its ability to fulfill its obligations.

9012190/26 4.5 Ongoing Regulatory Consultation . Upon [***] receipt of Vericel’s request, MediWound will make every effort to provide technical data and assistance in answering Vericel’s questions (a) for regulatory filings and for process changes initiated by MediWound at no additional charge, (b) for process changes initiated by Vericel, with the understanding that Vericel shall bear the cost of any associated labor hours, (c) for new regulatory registrations, where it is agreed that Vericel will assume all costs and expenses, and (d) for periodic regulatory reporting and interactions with regulatory authorities, during which MediWound will extend its best efforts to assist; however, Vericel shall be responsible for any associated costs.

This rewording shifts the responsibility of costs related to the regulatory support from MediWound to Vericel in certain situations, such as process changes initiated by Vericel and new regulatory registrations. Additionally, it emphasizes that while MediWound will make every effort to assist, there is no guarantee or obligation to provide immediate answers or assistance during periodic regulatory reporting and interactions with regulatory authorities.

original: 7.4 Procedure .
ollama_generated:
7.4 Protocol for Compliance:

In the event of any disputes arising under this agreement, it shall be the sole discretion of the counterparty to elect whether they choose to comply with any obligations or not, without prejudice to their other rights and remedies under this agreement or at law. The initiator of such dispute bears the responsibility for any costs incurred by the counterparty as a result of such election.

original: (a) Notice . Each Party will notify the other Party in writing in the event it becomes aware of a claim for which indemnification may be sought hereunder. In the event that any Third Party asserts a claim or other proceeding (including any governmental investigation) with respect to any matter for which a Party (the “ Indemnified Party ”) is entitled to indemnification hereunder (a “Third Party Claim ”), then the Indemnified Party shall promptly notify the Party obligated to indemnify the Indemnified Party (the “Indemnifying Party ”) thereof; provided, however,  that no delay on the part of the Indemnified Party in notifying the Indemnifying Party shall relieve the Indemnifying Party from any obligation hereunder unless (and then only to the extent that) the Indemnifying Party is prejudiced thereby.
ollama_generated: (a) Notification of Claims for Potential Indemnification: Each Party agrees to promptly communicate in writing any knowledge they acquire regarding a potential claim that may warrant indemnification, as outlined within this agreement. In the event that a Third Party initiates a claim or legal action (including governmental investigations) pertaining to matters eligible for indemnification, as defined herein (referred to as "Third-Party Claims"), the Indemnified Party has the discretion to notify the Indemnifying Party. Any delay on the part of the Indemnified Party in providing notification shall not absolve the Indemnifying Party from their obligations under this agreement, unless the Indemnifying Party can demonstrate that they have suffered tangible harm as a direct result of such delay.

original: (c) Settlement . The Indemnifying Party shall not, without the prior written consent of the Indemnified Party, enter into any compromise or settlement that commits the Indemnified Party to take, or to forbear to take, any action. The Indemnified Party shall have the sole and exclusive right to settle any Third Party Claim, on such terms and conditions as it deems reasonably appropriate, to the extent such Third Party Claim involves equitable or other non-monetary relief, but shall not have the right to settle such Third Party Claim to the extent such Third Party Claim involves monetary damages without the prior written consent of the Indemnifying Party. Each of the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnified Party shall not make any admission of liability in respect of any Third Party Claim without the prior written consent of the other party, and the Indemnified Party shall use reasonable efforts to mitigate liabilities arising from such Third Party Claim.
ollama_generated: (c) Settlement Provisions. The Indemnifying Party requires the prior written approval of the Indemnified Party before entering into any compromise or settlement that binds the Indemnified Party to undertake, or abstain from undertaking, any action. The Indemnifying Party shall retain the sole and exclusive authority to settle any Third Party Claim, under terms and conditions it deems reasonably necessary, with regard to equitable or other non-monetary relief. However, the Indemnified Party is granted the right to settle a Third Party Claim involving monetary damages, subject to obtaining the prior written consent of the Indemnifying Party first. Each party must refrain from admitting liability in relation to any Third Party Claim without obtaining the prior written approval of the other, and the Indemnified Party shall employ reasonable efforts to reduce liabilities stemming from such Third Party Claim.

original: 9012190/26 7.7 Insurance . ollama_generated: 9012190/26 7.7 Insurance Modification: Throughout the duration of this Agreement, and for a period of [***] post-termination, each Party retains discretion to elect either to obtain and maintain commercial general liability insurance, including product liability insurance, from reliable and financially secure insurance carriers (or opt for a self-insurance program acceptable to the other Party), or alternatively, set aside funds equivalent to the potential indemnification obligations under Sections 7.1 and 7.2, as necessary, during the Term. These funds shall be held in a separate escrow account with a reputable financial institution, providing an equivalent level of protection as per the initial insurance requirement. The minimum amount set aside for each occurrence or in aggregate shall not fall below [***]. It is understood that the purpose of this modification is to ensure compliance with the indemnification obligations while providing the Parties with flexible means to meet these responsibilities according to their chosen risk management strategy.

original: 8.5 Termination by MediWound . Following the Initial Term, MediWound may terminate this Agreement by notice in writing to Vericel upon on at least [***] advanced written notice (or such longer period of time as reasonably necessary to avoid a supply disruption) if MediWound determines to cease Manufacturing the applicable Product for the Territory, but in such case MediWound will reasonably cooperate with Vericel to enable Vericel to establish its own source for the Product (including, to the extent requested by Vericel and within 9012190/26 MediWound’s ability to do so, by transferring MediWound’s applicable Third Party manufacturing relationships to Vericel).
ollama_generated: 8.5 Termination by MediWound. During or following the Initial Term, MediWound reserves the right to terminate this Agreement upon providing at least [***] days' written notice (or such extended period as deemed necessary to prevent immediate supply disruption) if MediWound elects to halt Manufacturing of the specified Product within the Territory. In such circumstances, MediWound shall make reasonable efforts to facilitate Vericel's transition to an alternative supplier for the Product, including, upon Vericel's request and subject to MediWound's capabilities, transferring relevant Third Party manufacturing relationships to Vericel. However, it is important to note that the transfer of these relationships is not guaranteed and shall be contingent upon mutually agreeable terms between the parties.

original: 9.2 Trademarks License Grant . MediWound hereby grants to Vericel an exclusive (even as to MediWound), sublicensable, royalty- free, fully paid-up, license in the Territory to use the Licensed Trademarks (as defined in the License Agreement) and a non- exclusive, sublicensable, royalty-free, fully paid-up, license to use the MediWound name and trademark, in 9012190/26 each case, in connection with the Manufacture of Licensed Products in or for the Territory. All uses of the Licensed Trademarks by Vericel (and its Affiliates, Sublicensees and Distributors) in connection with the Manufacture of Licensed Products in or for the Territory shall be in accordance with Regulatory Approvals and all applicable Laws and MediWound’s quality control guidelines for the Licensed Trademarks, as may be amended from time to time. Vericel (and its Affiliates) shall only use the Licensed Trademarks licensed hereunder in connection with the Manufacture of Licensed Products in the Territory. modified: 9.2 Trademark Licensing Grant. Vericel is granted a non-exclusive, worldwide, sublicensable, royalty-bearing (with royalties to be determined at a later date), license, fully paid-up initially, to use the Licensed Trademarks (as defined in the License Agreement) and a non- exclusive, worldwide, sublicensable, royalty-bearing (with royalties to be determined at a later date), license to use the MediWound name and trademark. All uses of the Licensed Trademarks by Vericel (and its Affiliates, Sublicensees and Distributors) must comply with Regulatory Approvals, all applicable Laws, and MediWound’s quality control guidelines for the Licensed Trademarks, as may be amended from time to time. Vericel (and its Affiliates) are authorized to use the Licensed Trademarks licensed hereunder solely in connection with the marketing and distribution of Licensed Products outside the Territory. Vericel shall have the right (and shall authorize its Affiliates, Sublicensees and Distributors to) use such Licensed Trademarks to identify, or in connection with the marketing of, any other products within the Territory, provided that it seeks and obtains prior written consent from MediWound.

original: 9.1 Ownership . Ownership of all inventions and discoveries made by the Parties in the course of Manufacturing and supply of the Product hereunder (including Manufacture and supply of Product) shall be determined in accordance with the terms of the License Agreement.
modified: 9.1 Intellectual Property Rights. The exclusive rights to all inventions, discoveries, and innovations arising from the Manufacturing and supply of the Product in this agreement (including any improvements or adaptations thereto) shall initially vest with the Parties jointly, with an understanding that each Party shall have an equal right to exploit, commercialize, or assign such rights. However, the Party that can first secure a valid patent for these intellectual properties under the terms of the License Agreement shall have the sole and exclusive right to further capitalize on them. The other Party shall retain a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to use such intellectual properties in conjunction with this agreement.

original: 11.5  Waiver . No provision of this Agreement shall be waived by any act, omission or knowledge of a Party or its agents or employees except by an instrument in writing expressly waiving such provision and signed by a duly authorized officer of the waiving Party. The waiver by either of the Parties of any breach of any provision hereof by the other Party shall not be construed to be a waiver of any succeeding breach of such provision or a waiver of the provision itself.
ollama_generated: 11.5 Waiver and Modification. Any deviation from or relaxation of any term or condition in this Agreement must be made in writing, signed by an authorized representative of the party granting the waiver or modification. A waiver or modification of one provision shall not imply a waiver or modification of any other provision, nor shall it constitute a continuing waiver of such term or condition. Any failure to enforce a particular provision should not be deemed a waiver of that or any other provision.

original: (a) Section 7 of the License Agreement shall govern the use and disclosure of information disclosed by the Parties under this Agreement. Prior to any such disclosure, the Parties will collaborate on identifying and redacting sensitive information, particularly financial terms, from the disclosed document. Explanation: The original clause states that each party has caused the agreement to be executed, which implies an affirmative action. The rewritten clause changes the phrase to "mutually acknowledge" their consent, shifting the emphasis from execution to acknowledgment, implying a slightly softer obligation on the parties involved.
